articles.author: Andrew Mills, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Disagreements over Israel's future military presence in Gaza and over Palestinian prisoner releases are obstructing a ceasefire and hostage deal, according to ten sources familiar with the round of U.S.-mediated talks that concluded last week.
articles.title: Exclusive: Israeli demands for troops in Gaza blocking truce deal, sources say

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: The daughter of a Jamaican father and Indian mother, both immigrants, Kamala Harris reflects the United States' changing demographics.
articles.title: In Kamala Harris' multiracial roots, U.S. sees its own future

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian drone attacks killed two civilians and wounded a third on Thursday in Ukraine's Sumy region, on the border with Russia, the regional administration said in a statement.
articles.title: Ukraine says Russian drones kill two civilians in border area

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bullets were found in the bodies of the six Israeli hostages retrieved from Gaza this week, the Hostage Families Forum campaign group said on Thursday, citing recent autopsy reports.
articles.title: Bullets found in bodies of Israeli hostages retrieved from Gaza, hostage families forum says

articles.author: Paul Sandle
articles.description: Mike Lynch, the tech tycoon who died when his luxury yacht sank off Sicily, spent more than a decade building Britain's biggest software company and almost as long again fighting charges he had inflated its value to secure a multi-billion-pound sale.
articles.title: Mike Lynch was a British tech trailblazer who died at sea after US trial acquittal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Attackers with guns and rocket-propelled grenades ambushed a police convoy in Pakistan's eastern Punjab province on Thursday, killing at least 11 officers and wounding others, the Associated Press reported, citing police and officials.
articles.title: Attackers kill 11 police officers in eastern Pakistan, AP reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NASA on Thursday said it expects to announce on Saturday its decision on whether the two astronauts who rode Boeing's glitchy Starliner spacecraft to the International Space Station will need a SpaceX vehicle to return to Earth.
articles.title: NASA says decision on Boeing Starliner crew's path home coming Saturday

articles.author: Jasper Ward, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: An Arizona man is wanted after threatening over social media to kill former President Donald Trump, the Cochise County Sheriff's Office said on Thursday.
articles.title: Arizona man wanted for threatening to kill Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yemen's Houthis targeted the Sounion oil tanker and the SW North Wind I vessel in the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden, the Iran-aligned group's military spokesman Yahya Saree said on Thursday.
articles.title: Yemen's Houthis say they targeted two vessels in Red Sea and Gulf of Aden

articles.author: Dylan Bouscher
articles.description: Hundreds of California sea lions have taken over San Carlos Beach in Monterey, California, prompting local officials to close the area to people.
articles.title: Sea lions take over California beach
